subtypeRanged.name: Agripinaa Mk VIII Braced Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: Exchanging the iron sights of the better known Agripinaa autogun for heavy stock and counter-balanced barrel, this weapon is well-suited for mowing down hordes of foes.

subtypeRanged.name: Columnus Mk II Braced Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: A commander's prime concern is strategy. A soldier's duty is to plant their feet and blaze away. - Lord Militant Ennic Baross

subtypeRanged.name: Graia Mk IV Braced Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: They say the forge world be cursed. Ha! Give me a hundred soldiers armed with such weapons, and by the Emperor I say it's the enemy who'll feel the curse! - Captain Jerzy Modamus

subtypeRanged.name: Agripinaa Mk VIII Headhunter Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: One of the newest autogun STCs to be uncovered by the Tech-Priests of Agripinaa, the Mk VIII couples excellent range with a devastating burst firing mode.

subtypeRanged.name: Vraks Mk VII Headhunter Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: Heavily modified to combat snipers during siege actions, the Vraks Headhunter is an unusual single-shot autogun designed for high-accuracy takedowns.

subtypeRanged.name: Vraks Mk III Headhunter Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: A prized autogun pattern from the vaunted manufactorums of Vraks, the Mk III sacrifices rate of fire in favour of increased range.

subtypeRanged.name: Graia Mk VIII Infantry Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: Well-regarded for their high rate of fire and sturdy construction, these autoguns are in short supply after a series of calamities befell the forge world of Graia.

subtypeRanged.name: Columnus Mk V Infantry Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: A rarity in the Moebian Domain, Columnus autoguns are prized for their high rate of fire, if somewhat deafening report.

subtypeRanged.name: Agripinaa Mk I Infantry Autogun
subtypeRanged.description: Unsubtle weapons, known for their excessive kick and bright muzzle flash, Agripinaa autoguns are still popular due to their stopping power and reliability.

subtypeRanged.name: Ius Mk III Shredder Autopistol
subtypeRanged.description: More popular with hive gangers than Moebian military forces, this autopistol's devastating rate of fire is near-legendary.

subtypeRanged.name: Locke Mk IIb Spearheard Boltgun
subtypeRanged.description: A variant of an old Adeptus Arbites design, Lock-pattern boltguns are known for their reliability and stopping power.

subtypeRanged.name: Lawbringer MK VI Combat Shotgun
subtypeRanged.description: Based on the ubiquitous weapon long carried by the Adeptus Arbites, this semi-automatic shotgun is deadly at short range.

subtypeRanged.name: Artemia Mk III Purgation Flamer
subtypeRanged.description: Hailing from the same forge world as the mighty Hellhound flame tank, this weapon uses volatile promethium to scour heretics with fire.

subtypeRanged.name: Rifthaven Mk II Purgatus Force Staff
subtypeRanged.description: The Inquisitor leads the way with words of benevolence, his force staff held like a symbol of faith. But make no mistake: they are no shepherds of the meek. They are destroyers of worlds. - High Ecclesiarch Renald Kothar

subtypeRanged.name: Nomanus Mk VI Surge Force Staff
subtypeRanged.description: A Force Staff grounds a Psyker, helping them resist daemonic possession.

subtypeRanged.name: Equinox MK III Trauma Force Staff
subtypeRanged.description: Through the intricate psi-convectors of a force staff, a Psyker harnesses the pure energy of the warp, unleashing it upon their enemies in ferocious psychic cavalcades.

subtypeRanged.name: Equinox Mk IV Voidstrike Force Staff
subtypeRanged.description: Let your mind be the weapon. The staff is merely there to light the darkness.

subtypeRanged.name: Blastoom Mk III Grenadier Gauntlet
subtypeRanged.description: A heavy grenade launcher beloved of Bullgryn units, grenadier gauntlets are strapped to their user's arm simply to prevent the slow-witted Ogryn from losing them...

subtypeRanged.name: Krourk Mk V Twin-Linked Heavy Stubber
subtypeRanged.description: Nothing gets an Ogryn's blood up quite like the deafening noise and high-power recoil of a full-auto heavy weapon, and they don't come much louder or more powerful than a twin-linked heavy stubber.

subtypeRanged.name: Lorenz Mk V Kickback
subtypeRanged.description: The orbital manufactorum Lorenz is most well-known for forging heavy ordnance for the Imperial Navy. As a sideline, however, its Tech-Adepts create Ogryn-proof field weapons based on primitive designs.

subtypeRanged.name: Lucius Mk III Helbore Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: With their extended barrels and bayonet loops, Lucius-pattern lasguns are well-regarded by assault troops who seek out melee after discharging a few volleys.

subtypeRanged.name: Lucius Mk II Helbore Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: A more elegant design of the Lucius Mk i. Once the preserve of officers in the Death Korps of Krieg, this aging but reliable model has found its way into the hands of soldiers across the galaxy.

subtypeRanged.name: Lucius Mk I Helbore Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: Most Lucius-pattern lasguns operate in the 21 megathoule range, discharging a more powerful shot, but draining their power packs more rapidly.

subtypeRanged.name: Kantrael MG IV Infantry Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: The MG Mk IV was something of a short-lived experiment, sacrificing stopping power in favor of an improved rate of fire.

subtypeRanged.name: Kantrael MG XII Infantry Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: With its improved charge pack and focussing array, the MG XII is amongst the most powerful lasguns to come out of the manufactorums of Kantrael, albeit somewhat slower to fire than its cousins.

subtypeRanged.name: Kantrael MG Ia Infantry Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: ++DILIGENCE IS DUTY++

subtypeRanged.name: Accatran Mk VId Recon Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: The Accatran Mk VI Series is an evolutionary offshoot of the Mk IV, so beloved of the Elysian Drop Troops. The improved rate of fire comes from its more efficient charge pack at the expense of stopping power.

subtypeRanged.name: Accatran Mk VIIa Recon Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: They say the lasgun is a 'humble' weapon. I say it's the most efficient tool in the galaxy. Billions of liberated souls can't be wrong. - Lord Militant Ennic Baross

subtypeRanged.name: Accatran Mk II Recon Lasgun
subtypeRanged.description: The Accatran Mk VI Series is an evolutionary offshoot of the Mk IV, so beloved of the Elysian Drop Troops. The improved rate of fire comes from its more efficient charge pack at the expense of stopping power.

subtypeRanged.name: Accatran MG Mk II Heavy Laspistol
subtypeRanged.description: Used by officers of the Astra Militarum throughout the galaxy, this heavy laspistol packs a considerable punch.

subtypeRanged.name: M35 Magnacore Mk II Plasma Gun
subtypeRanged.description: Firing an energized ball of hydrogen-based plasma along a linear electromagnetic accelerator, plasma guns are deadly, if prone to dangerous overheating.

subtypeRanged.name: Zarona Mk IIa Quickdraw Stub Revolver
subtypeRanged.description: One of the most ancient pistol designs, stub revolvers endure across myriad frontier worlds thanks to their durability, simplcity and effectiveness.

subtypeRanged.name: Foe-Rend Mk II Ripper Gun
subtypeRanged.description: A ripper gun is, in essence, a heavy, automatic shotgun. They are built as simply and solidly as possible, because most Ogryns in the field forget about shooting, instead using whatever they have to hand as improvised melee weapons.

subtypeRanged.name: Foe-Rend Mk VI Ripper Gun
subtypeRanged.description: No description

subtypeRanged.name: Foe-Rend Mk V Ripper Gun
subtypeRanged.description: A rare pattern of ripper gun, the Foe-Rend Mk V was an attempt to use a tightly focussed scatter shell to improve the Ogryns' aim at long range. Given the Ogryn propensity for charging widly into combat, the experiment was quickly abandoned.

subtypeRanged.name: Lorenz Mk VI Rumbler
subtypeRanged.description: One of the simplest grenade launchers constructed in the Imperium, 'rumblers' have more in common with primitive mortars than the usual weaponry made on the Lorenz forge world.
